Hi!

I’m a third year graduate student in the Linguistics Department at the University of Maryland, College Park where I’m also a Language Science Fellow.

Broadly, I’m interested in the semantics and pragmatics of wh-words, and their acquisition. I’m advised by Valentine Hacquard and Jeff Lidz. See research for more.

When I’m not doing linguistics, I help take care of community cats with A Cat’s Life Rescue.

Here’s my CV.

Recent updates

  • I will present my work “Do children know whanything? Acquisition of wh-ambiguity in Mandarin” with Dan Goodhue, Valentine Hacquard, and Jeff Lidz at WCCFL2020 and IASCL2020;
  • I will present my work “Commitment issue: a unified accout of Mandarin discourse particle ba” at SALT30 and PLC44;
  • I will present my work “Acquisition of belief reports by Mandarin children” with Valentine Hacquard and Jeff Lidz at IASCL2020.
